p: The administrations of C. murale and R. abyssinicus extracts significantly (P < 0.05) reduced HGB concentrations(13.11 + 1.31 g/dl) and 14.10 + 2.52 g/dl, respectively, compared with control (18.23 + 1.00/g/dl). Clinically meaningful increment of RBC concentration was observed, although it did not reach statistical significance compared with the control (4.75 Ã— 10 6/mm3 Cells). Most of the hematological biomarkers remain within the normal limit in comparison with the control group (P > 0.05) ( Table 2).
